it.polito.computervision.virtualscreen

Interface VirtualScreen

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractVirtualScreen, FlatVirtualScreen

    public interface VirtualScreen
    Represents a generic 2D virtual screen in front of the user.
    Author:
    giovanni

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.openni.Point2D<java.lang.Float> get2DProjection(com.primesense.nite.Point3D<java.lang.Float> point)
      Converts the 3D point into its 2D projection on the virtual screen.
      float getDepth() 
      Size getSize()

    • Method Detail

      • getSize

        Size getSize()
        Returns:
        the size of the virtual screen

      • setSize

        void setSize(Size size)
        Sets the size of the virtual screen
        Parameters:
        size - The new size of the virtual screen

      • getDepth

        float getDepth()
        Returns:
        the depth of the virtual screen (i.e. its distance from the origin of the world coordinate system along the Z axis)

      • setDepth

        void setDepth(float depth)
        Sets the depth of the virtual screen
        Parameters:
        depth - The new depth of the virtual screen

      • isTouching

        boolean isTouching(com.primesense.nite.Point3D<java.lang.Float> point)
        Checks if the given 3D point is touching the 2D virtual screen
        Parameters:
        point - The 3D point to check
        Returns:
        true if it is touching the virtual screen, false otherwise.

      • get2DProjection

        org.openni.Point2D<java.lang.Float> get2DProjection(com.primesense.nite.Point3D<java.lang.Float> point)
        Converts the 3D point into its 2D projection on the virtual screen. Notice that Point3D comes from com.primesense.nite package, whereas Point2D comes from org.openni package. The reason is that Point2D's constructor is not visible.
        Parameters:
        point - The 3D point to convert
        Returns:
        the 2D projection of the point on the virtual screen
